body: I believe X is referring to X.yyy specs(ITU). LDAP v3 is an RFC spec. X'specs were for directory support(X.500-X.522). Even with X' golang does support X.509. So the argument is not valid. Also, LDAP is structured, uses ASN.1 for structured data representation. LDAP is core to system authentication  and authorization. Not supporting LDAP will restrict adoption of golang for security applications.
